title: Single molecule investigations of the mechanical chemical and structural properties of biomolecules
abstractText: Abstracts are not currently available in GtR for all funded research. This is normally because the abstract was not required at the time of proposal submission, but may be because it included sensitive information such as personal details.
impactText: Purchase of a state-of the-art instrument allowed several groups to publish high impact research papers that underpinned later grant applications to the BBSRC and EPSRC Manufacturing, including Industrial Biotechology,Pharmaceuticals and Medical Biotechnology
findingsText: Funds to purchase cutting edge AFM instruments allowed a wide range of experiments to be undertaken. The outputs and summary of their findings are detailed in the publications arising from this grant. Understanding the mechanical/material properties of biomolecules is necessary in the design of molecular scaffolds, in the industrial processing of biomolcules and in the design of bio-sensors. Manufacturing, including Industrial Biotechology,Pharmaceuticals and Medical Biotechnology
